Reviews.Title: “Felt like a princess in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Bex10121
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, the staff at the Hotel Daniel did everything try could to make us feel at home. The food was delicious, the room was spacious and beautifully decorated and I loved the touch of molton brown bathroom goodies. The location is lovely, one a quiet street close to a metro stop and a few minutes to the Champs-Élysées. Yes it is expensive, but you get a tranquil retreat that was an indulgence that made my time in Paris so much more special. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “I did not stay and could not find how to review the superb food in the only Relais & Chateaux rated hotel and restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: Toyo3
Reviews.Content: A friend of our recommended the hotel to eat. I wished I had stayed in the hotel! The food was SUPERB!! Very expensive but worth every cent!! Service was excellent and I have never gone wrong with a Relais & Chateaux.... I am becoming more and more of a believer now. It is very close to the Arc de Triomphe; walking maybe 3-5 min.

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel”
Reviews.Author: Asma-Maria A
Reviews.Content: Located a few walking minutes away from the Champs-Elysees, luxurious, friendly, beautifully charming. Staff is lovely and efficient. A "petit bijou" in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Parisienne Treasure”
Reviews.Author: LondonNinoshka
Reviews.Content: A charming beautifully appointed hotel that is both homely and elegant. We love the all day breakfast and tempting tray of fruit, croissants and sweeties that guests can enjoy any time they like. So romantic and beautifully appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming atmosphare, friendly and efficient service”
Reviews.Author: Fabio3030
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to stay at this hotel since March 2011. We stayed for four nights. Although this is not like a fanciest hotel in Paris such as Bristol, Ritz, Crillon, I appreciate very much its charming atmosphare, small but luxuary accomodations, and friendly and highly efficient staff. For the first day we arrived very late night but we relaxed soon thanks to delicious room service meals available 24 hours. Breakfast with delicious pastries and bread from Ladurer, a prominent boutique for sweets in Paris. Moreover the most remarkable point is the clealiness of room. Our room was cleaned up at least twice a day in a so careful way that even a high-end hotel in Tokyo could not realize. We will certainly back to the hotel for our next travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbh
Reviews.Content: An exceptionally welcoming staff. Beautiful accomodations. The Daniel Suite is roomy and very nicely decorated with an Eiffel Tower View from the terrace. The hotel is on a quiet street close to the Champs. Breakfast either American or continental is done very nicely. Some wonderful restaurants in the area as well. (two blocks to the metro if you want) Worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dina-dxb
Reviews.Content: It really is a charming hotel, very parisienne and great atmosphere. The breakfast is not wow, but the staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is ideal, parallel to the Champs Elysees, in a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and beautiful; a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: MoscowLala
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Daniel with my parents in June this year. I cannot fault the hotel: the service was warm, the staff extremely helpful (even before we got there by assisting with restaurant reservations) and the hotel beautiful. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Haven of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: duenna
Reviews.Content: Small, elegant, centrally located hotel that will enhance any trip to Paris. Particularly good value.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olie079
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Daniel for 3 nights following a cruise. It was very clean and the staff were lovely - very helpful and friendly. We arrived very early in the morning and they gave us a room to use until our room had been made up, which we were very grateful for. The decor was charming and the detail went as far as lace edged liners in the cupboards. Breakfast was included which was a bonus, the cappuccinos in the lounge were great and it was only a short walk to the Champs Elysees. We used the hotel drivers for pick up and airport drop-off and they were very reliable and courteous. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this lovely hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Andnat
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed, pampered and our room upgraded almost before we had arrived! The place is spotless and a true boutique hotel. The staff were amazing, the room was absolutely wonderful and we wanted for nothing. Breakfast was basic and although this is not a cheap place to stay, it's position close to the Champs Elysees and the comfort and service made it well worth every Euro!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: combas
Reviews.Content: I can't say anything negative against this hotel. Although the room rates are a bit steep for what you get (also compared with other hotels in the same price category). The hotel is located very well, in a quiet road, but just some steps away from many touristic attractions. There are also some nice restaurants in the area, from bistros to the 2 star michelin restaurant Apicius (located just around the corner). The staff was very helpful and they served an excellent continental breakfast (i liked especially the mixed bread basket). This hotel is really not a 8/15 type hotel. The decoration inspired by the art of chinoiserie is very special. Even if it is not your taste, you will have a lot to discover in this hotel. Unfortunately the rooms are quite tiny for two persons. This is not unusual in Paris, but for 350 Euro for the cheapest room (classic, twin bed room) I just expected a bit more than a nice handpainted chinoiserie style wallpaper.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious but small room”
Reviews.Author: havefun71
Reviews.Content: Hotel Daniel was lovely, clean, comfortable, the staff was courteous and helpful, and the food wonderful. However, the rooms, while plush,are very small, the location is safe but on a side street off an unattractively commercial part of the Champs-Elysees, and it is expensive (for example, a breakfast omelet can set you back $30). I wouldn't mind staying there again, but don't plan to do so, mainly because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Paris has faded but remains expensive”
Reviews.Author: PFoggSydney
Reviews.Content: We took a suite at the Hotel Daniel for three nights. The website is gorgeous the hotel less so. It is all a bit jaded and faded. The staff is generally good but you get the strong feeling the hotel has seen better days. The suite was small but comfortable. There was a nice balcony and a good shower.The continental breakfast was fine but limited in the typically French fashion. To my mind, the cost of the Hotel Daniel was too high for what is provided. Perhaps we travel too much in Asia. Nevertheless, it seemed excessive for what we got. To be fair maybe the problem was the Daniel costs the same as a five star in Asia but is only a four star hotel, and The Daniel is what it is, so perhaps it suffers by comparison. The pluses were the location, close to the touristy things but sufficiently away to feel genuinely Parisian. It is a small hotel and that seemed somehow more in keeping with the nature of Paris. The manager was efficient and resourceful and any problems were sorted out quickly. You could do a lot worse in Paris I guess, and for a lot more money you could probably do better. C'est la vie.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: aussie_meee
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful little place just a block from the Champs Elysees. There are lots of nice restaurants in the area and the breakfast in the hotel is great. Each room is different and has charm. The staff are friendly and helpful. We just enjoyed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: JWJL
Reviews.Content: Everything's perfect at this little hotel, all other reviews are true- the rooms the service the ambiance have all been done to perfection. However what impressed us most was the manager Madame CÃ©cile's effort to make us feel like home. She looked after us so well and exerted so much warmth as if she was running a 3-room bed & breakfast tucked away in some tranquil countryside. We actually tried out another boutique hotel in the same area on the 2nd day of our stay in Paris, but it was not comparable at all, so we checked out on the 4th day and went back to Hotel Daniel. The rooms we've stayed that were all wonderful and cozy and made us not want to go out: A blue single room (CÃ©cile offered that while our room was being prepared), a junior suite, a Daniel suite. The location is great but most taxi drivers had problem locating the tiny street, we always asked them to drop us on the main street Rue D'Artois which they all knew. that wasn't a problem at all because the hotel entrance is just 10 steps away from the crossroad.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Daniel more than exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: joanntours
Reviews.Content: I think I could spend a week here and not see and experience all the appointments at this delightful treasure just off the Champs. Our four night stay was a tranquil and peaceful experience. Excellent, safe location Quiet and elegant. Definitely dine in house. Once you have had the ordinary faire of the neighboring restaurants, you'll love the feeling of being in a private dining room with gracious staff not missing a beat. The hotel chef is its best kept secret! Amazing breakfast and dinner. Beautiful parlour for before an after dinner cocktails, coffee or a private business meeting. I could not have been more satisfied. If you care where you stay and want an experience rather than just a place to sleep, Hotel Daniel is the well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis with bijoux feeling”
Reviews.Author: Globe-World
Reviews.Content: Hotel Daniel, ticks all my boxes: rooms are charming without being quaint, the restaurant offers good food and has genuinely caring staff, they pay attention to detail and are very helpful. The Salon the thÃ© transports you to a magical carefree environment, relax and enjoy. Location; just close enough to all the sights but with a secluded feeling.

Reviews.Title: “C'est si bon -- Truly Lovely & Charming!”
Reviews.Author: TravelDeeds
Reviews.Content: We spent (my 72 yr. old mother, my 13 yr. old nephew and I) 3 days / nights at the Hotel Daniel, and we all truly enjoyed our stay. From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed. While they couldn't offer us early check-in, they happily provided us with temporary rooms to refresh and take a catnap to recover from our long journey. When we did get our rooms, we were given two lovely rooms on the 3rd floor that were connected. The breakfasts were robust and delicious. The service was outstanding. The hotel staff (from the manager to the doormen to the concierge to the waiters) were gracious, friendly and helpful. And the manager was one of the hardest working I've come across -- she was very accessible, offered terrific advice and always wore a smile. The rooms were well appointed and the ambience was serene. Molten Brown products were available in the bathrooms. We departed the hotel very early in the morning (way before breakfast is served), and they still offered us coffee and wrapped up their delicious pastries for us to take with us. True, Hotel Daniel is pricey. But you get what you pay for in our opinion. You cannot go wrong here. This small boutique offering is superior and preferable to the large hotels that command the same prices.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Wonderful Ambience”
Reviews.Author: odysseytaker
Reviews.Content: As with previous reviews, we want to add how this hotel made our recent five night stay in Paris (in spite of all the rain!) extremely comfortable. It was not just the comfort of our room, but the warmth and friendliness of the staff. We arrived very early in the a.m. from the U.S. and were very generously allowed to get some much needed rest in an empty room until our double was available. We found the bed and linens top notch and the bathroom, albeit compact, modern and efficient. We had plenty of space to hang clothes in closets that were efficiently located in a small hallway entry into our room. There was no fee for the wireless internet connection. The room had a large desk on which to place our laptop and other items, as well as a comfortable chair. We had breakfast each morning at the hotel's restaurant and one dinner. The food was good and, as everywhere in Paris expensive, but not out of our price range. The location was convenient to all Paris attractions either by foot or Metro. We cannot thank the staff enough for their kind, helpful, and friendly welcome during our stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a road weary traveller needs...”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: This is everything a Four Seasons is not. It is sedate, understated and intimate. The other reviews have it about right in my opinion. The restaurant is top notch also with about five dining tables. Do not stay here if you are budget conscious, as we found the suites much better than the double room that we had for the last night. Small rooms maybe and small bathrooms - so what. I prefer this to all the glitz of the latest self acclaimed seven star hotels in Macau and Dubai. Almost like a very good Japanese hotel in many ways. Our stay was like the Connaught in London in the old days - they know who you are the moment you arrive and treat you with great professionalism as well as warmth. No signing of bills - thank god.

Reviews.Title: “adorable”
Reviews.Author: desperatetorelax
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for my 30th bday, and decided not to go for a suite but asked for deluxe room 602 which is beautiful and has view eiffel tower and is recommneded by mr and mrs smith boutique hotel books(a must in anyones book shelf).the past reviewer is right in that i think a suite might not be worth it and yes the baths are tiny, you can squeeze 2 in but only just!!! of course everything because of the exchange rate seems crazy, we popped out to get pastries for breaky rather than pay Â£28 for the same. but as it was my 30th we forgot about worrying too much about that and just got on with it, the staff were so friendly and helpful, the hotel stunningly chic and so private, a real home from home. scrumptious room service, all the litle things that so important thought of. and we even got morning free champers on monday, how nice is that!!! j'adore! x

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Massively Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: jamesmooney100
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Daniel for pure luxury, and at 510 Euro's per night for a junior suite we expected it! The Hotel itself is certainly fantastically located, friendly, welcoming, intimate and beautifully appointed throughout. Had it been priced at 300 Euro's per night or less we would not hesitate to recommend. Unfortunately though, it was simply not worth the money paid; the rooms were very small, and the bathroom's, although again, beautifully appointed, were tiny (I'm a small man and I hardly fitted into the bath!) Paris is an expensive city, particularly with the falling pound, but this Hotel was simply too expensive. A bottle of water was Â£6, a cup of English Tea even more expensive, almost a tenner! The first 'junior suite' we were given was a combination of two tiny rooms (with a worn carpet) and so we swapped to a second room, which was better, but still very small. Over the course of the weekend we checked the rack rates at many other great hotels we walked past (we have every intention of returning to Paris) and, unless you have money to burn, there is simply no need to book this hotel. Oh, and the 'reasonably priced restaurant' recommended by concierge on our first night charged Â£40 for a steak and chips that I could have got from M&S! We had a great weekend though, just came home a lot lighter in the pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Magical”
Reviews.Author: FlashSydney
Reviews.Content: This is the sort of hotel you come to Paris for - beautifully furnished, helpful, friendly staff who can't do enough and a great location. Only two minutes from the Champs-Elysees, the hotel is in a beautiful residential street. The perfect situation - close to the action and yet private. As you enter the lobby looks like a huge sitting room which makes it very comfortable for families, couples and people on their own. The property is part of the Relais & Chateaux group so there is a big emphasis on food both in the restaurant and at breakfast. The breakfast is fantastic - from the perfectly cooked eggs to the wonderful coffee. A laptop is available for free use and all the staff are genuinely friendly. We had to leave very early in the morning but serving a proper breakfast was no problem at all. Charm might be an old-fashioned word but this hotel possesses this increasingly rare quality to the max. I have recommended it to many friends already and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: HBDC
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at Hotel Daniel for a week on a trip for our 30th Anniversary. We couldn't have stayed at a place that was nicer. The staff was friendly and helpful, our room ( as mentioned on this website, so it was expected) was small but beautifully appointed ( black and white toile upholstered the walls, the furnishings were lovely, and we had a sparkling marble bathroom.) The public spaces - a small lounge/lobby and restaurant- were charming and the food was great. I had told them this was our annversary and a sweet note and champagne greeted us on our arrival. The location was very convenient - still, it was very quiet. I don't know how they managed to be cozy and chic at the same time - but we really felt welcome in Paris at this warm and stylish hotel. HIghly recommended- especially for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Daniel”
Reviews.Author: PollyAberdeen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in one of the suites at the Hotel Daniel for a long weekend. The hotel is situated in a quiet area just off the Champs Elysees and so was perfectly central yet peaceful. The decor throughout the hotel is incredibly pretty, with beautiful chinoisserie and attention to detail. Staff were obliging and polite with good local knowledge as to the best places to eat/drink. If you are looking for a short relaxing stay in beautiful surroundings in the cenre of Paris, I would definately recommend the Hotel Daniel.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic city break”
Reviews.Author: Windsor_Trekker
Reviews.Content: Hotel Daniel came highly recommended by my travel agent. And suffice to say I truly enjoyed the peaceful & romantic ambience of the hotel (decorated in a Chinoiserie style). Its location is excellent for shopping & eating as it is located within a stone's throw from Louis Vuitton & Gucci boutiques on/near the Champs Elyssee! The hotel staff also provided excellent service, as they helped make restaurant reservations & secured tickets to avoid those notoriously long museum queues! Truly enjoyed my stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: jeffJBloomington
Reviews.Content: I wrote the first review for Residence Bassano several years ago and it appears in the top ten of Trip Advisors' rankings. Last month, I spent three nights in Paris with one of my daughters,who is studying in Italy. We had a junior suite in the Daniel. It was fine. Our living room was perfect for our needs. The bathroom was a bit tiny compared to the U.S. "standard". The walls were covered with fabric and the living room had adequate space for happy hour. The service was top drawer, five stars...the staff speaks English. They go out of their way to accomodate you...they will give you breakfast at off hours...fix you a boxed meal if requested, and generally, give you anything you want. This is a small, boutique hotel. I have stayed at many Relais and Chateaux hotels in Europe, and this one is small and different from those. That said, the service is impeccable. No, it's more than than that....it's outstanding. I gave a box of American chocolates to the front desk because I appreciated their effort and I wanted them to like Americans. Stay here. Compared to the Residence Bassano, which I launched with an early review...this hotel is more up scale. It's on the oppostie side of the Champs Elyisses but close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sitting Room”
Reviews.Author: London_Lucy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The hotel is a small boutique hotel and one of the relais and chateaux group. The design is beautiful - a lot of chinoiserie and eastern influence. And the sitting room is just gorgeous. The reception staff are very helpful indeed. The bathrooms are spacious and well designed and stocked full of molton brown goodies. It's conveniently located for the Champs Elysees and the Eiffel Tower and walking to the Marais along the river and through the Tuilleries is fantastic (but not for the infirm!) The only minor issue that I had was that there was no turn down service in the evenings which felt a little strange. The hotel is small and beautifully formed and would suit those who want a haven of peaceful luxury. If you were looking for something on a grande scale this would not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: PoshHotelJunky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Daniel for New Year's Eve 2006 and it's a really lovely hotel in a quiet location very close to the Champs-Elysees. I booked a junior suite which was a little cheaper through Relais & Chateaux. The hotel staff were very friendly indeed. The receptionist took us to our room and apologised for a small stain on the carpet (I hadn't noticed and it was gone a few hours later!) The room was beautifully decorated, the bed was very comfortable indeed and the small bathroom was nice too. The pain au chocolat at breakfast were absolutely delicious! Just how they should be!!

Reviews.Title: “great discovery !”
Reviews.Author: rzzoom
Reviews.Content: This is a great discovery,a gem of a hotel with pleasing design which lends itself to inviduality rather than just paying lip service to Phillipe Starck (who,incidentally is a real master himself) I gather that the owners furnish the hotel with artefacts gathered from all over the world and this is immediately transparent upon entering the small but delightful reception. There is a feeling of being in someone's home.Although it has a freshness,masses of colour and a good deal of elegance the staff,the ambience and the overall intimacy of the place lends itself to a feeling of well being and comfort. The staff try very hard to please,the concierge is outstanding,the location is good.Breakfast is plentiful and very nice,not outstanding,but perfectly acceptable. I take the point from the minority of reviewers that (some of) the rooms are a bit on the small side but they are exquisitely decorated and consequently deserving of praise. This hotel wins on the grounds that it is something different,a fresh addition to the myriad of design hotels that tend to work to a format.The Daniel has clearly been a labour of love for the owners.Not for them some anonymous,bland decor..instead every detail,lamps,car[ets,mirrors and even the luxurious supplies in the bathroom have clearly been painstakenly devised. I wish I could give this hotel four and a half stars.For me it just falls short of the 5 but is a long way ahead of the 4. The only factor that prevents me giving maximum marks is the relative smallness of the rooms but dont forget they are furnishes superbly. This hotel is a must for visitors with a healthy but not endless budget. A terrific hotel,great staff,Allez daniel !! Paul Southend On Sea Essex

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: Shahira
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing little boutique hotel. I have been to Paris alot but the last few time Danielle was the place I went to. I fell in love with boutique hotels ever since then! the location is amazing on a quiet street but 2 minutes walk from the champs with its noise, cafe, shopping metro stations and everything. Staff is amazing and friendly and the service is personal, they cater to you! Everyone knows ur name and what you like best, for example I used the laptop and internet after breakfast so it was ready everyday at that time. Rooms are a bit small but decor is eccentric and bright, the suites are better if you like more space. bathrooms is magnificent with great soaps and shampoos wonderful clean towels. This hotel is concerned with the details so there are alot of little fancy details in the room, bathroom and services. they can tell you ur way around paris from rest reccomendations, the easiest way to go to some place...etc AMAZING STAY looking forward to my next visit there, its one of the things I go back to Paris for now!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Daniel
HotelInfo.Address: 8 Rue Frederic Bastiat | entre les Champs Elysees et la rue du Faubourg Saint Honoré, 75008 Paris, France
